text: It's been a long time since I looked at the ESPRIT paper, but I remember it being set up for complex sinusoids.  So, if your data are real, then yes, you'd want to use 2*(the number of real sinusoids you expect) for the model size in order to capture the positive and negative frequencies for each real sinusoid.  I think the documentation of the Julia function is a bit ambiguous at various parts, but note that it says that the data can be complex, so that is the tip off that you need to be careful with the model size.
